text: Imma asaphoneura is a moth in the family Immidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1934. It is found in Taiwan. The wingspan is 17–19 mm. The forewings are rather dark fuscous, the veins partially indicated by indistinct lines of pale yellowish suffusion, especially towards the base and beyond the cell. There is an irregular slightly oblique pale yellowish fasciate patch from the middle of the costa reaching halfway across the wing, limited posteriorly by an indistinct dark fuscous transverse spot on the end of the cell. There is also a well-marked ochreous-yellow denticulate terminal line. The hindwings are rather dark grey.Exotic Microlepidoptera. 4 (15): 457. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1934 Category:Immidae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Imma asaphoneura
